summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/06/15 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Cole'], 'Producers': ['Stuart Chait', 'Dominique Anders', 'Jonathan Koch', 'Steven Michaels', 'Johnathan Walton', 'Alex Piper', 'Sapna Chhabra', 'Mary Courtney', 'Susan Huffaker'], 'Starring': ['Henry Rollins'], 'Studio': ['History']} Review Text: Interesting trivia. Too. Ad the topics are so limited. Also, I can't stand how the host sounds like he's talking to 3rd graders. Review Title: Fun facts Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Frontline Review Date: 2013/12/26 Categories: Documentary, Talk Show and Variety, Special Interest Product Description: ['Hailed upon its television broadcast debut as "the last best hope for broadcast documentaries," Frontline\'s stature over more than 28 years is reaffirmed each week through incisive documentaries covering the scope and complexity of the human experience.'] Average Rating: 3.4 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Michael Kirk', 'Ofra Bikel', 'Marcela Gaviria', 'Rick Young', 'Neil Docherty', 'William Cran', 'Jon Palfreman', 'Martin Smith', 'Thomas Jennings', 'Daniel Edge']} Review Text: ...it makes me feel smart.it doesn't even matter that a few years have passed since these originally aired, I still learn something every time. Review Title: Love this show because Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/02/01 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryn Higgins'], 'Producers': ['Bryn Higgins'], 'Starring': ['Cherie Lunghi', 'Nicholas Farrell', 'Charity Wakefield'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']} Review Text: Despite medical advances and social progress, the issues in every episode seem to parallel those of modern day life. Kinda makes me question "progress".

It makes me laugh every time someone requests a bottle of cocaine solution. It seems poorly named. I believe today we would call that a cocaine problem.

Note: Don't watch this show while eating. Review Title: Progress. Science. Silly hats. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/07/29 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['HBO'], 'Producers': ['Tom Hanks', 'Gary Goetzman', 'Mark V. Olsen', 'Will Scheffer', 'Bernadette Caulfield', 'Jill Sprecher', 'Karen Sprecher'], 'Starring': ['Bill Paxton', 'Jeanne Tripplehorn', 'Chloe Sevigny'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: I can't help it, I have a sick fascination with the Plygs. Review Title: I'm too needy, but... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/12/07 Average Rating: 3.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Hancock'], 'Producers': ['Sam Hancock', 'Keren Hantman', 'Michael Navarra', 'Maria Victoria Ponce'], 'Starring': ['Alanna Ubach', 'Michael Navarra', 'Patrick Russell']} Review Text: I kept hoping it would get better...it didn't. I mocked the Southern accent, which I know is wrong, but it entertained me, y'all. Review Title: Like a bad after school special Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/12/07 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Werner'], 'Producers': ['Norman Cohen'], 'Starring': ['Lea Thompson', 'Robert Englund'], 'Studio': ['Fisher Klingenstein Films']} Review Text: Favorite scene: dancing by herself at the bar, the actress does some of the most cringe-worthy pelvic thrusts the world has ever seen. I replayed it several times just to relive the awkward moment. Review Title: Dear 90s, sorry about your hair & clothes Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/09 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Selditch', 'David Metzler', 'John DeTarsio', 'Adam Heydt', 'Josh Bingham'], 'Producers': ['David Metzler', 'John Maroney', 'Brad Bishop', 'Karin Jarlstedt', 'Sitarah Pendelton', 'Derek Klein'], 'Starring': ['Schulman', 'Nev', 'Joseph', 'Max'], 'Studio': ['Viacom']} Review Text: Incredibly surprised by this show. Who would have thought this type of show could be done so thoughtfully? Review Title: Nev & Max are adorable! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/08/06 Average Rating: 3.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Pamela Romanowsky'], 'Producers': ['Vince Jolivette', 'James Franco', 'James Reach', 'Joseph McKelheer', 'Marni Zelnick', 'Ryan Dorff', 'Bill Kiely', 'Leo Kiely', 'Robert Redford'], 'Starring': ['James Franco', 'Ed Harris', 'Amber Heard'], 'Studio': ['A24']} Review Text: Good movie, but the story isn't terribly original. It reminds me of bits of movies and books that I've seen/read before, like A Million Little Pieces. Still, it provides nearly 2 hours of entertainment. Review Title: Good, but not original Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
This person exhibits a preference for documentaries and shows that provide educational value, consistently rating content that delivers insight and learning experiences highly. They often express enjoyment of trivia and the exploration of social issues, indicating an affinity for materials that provoke thought and discussion. Ratings fluctuating from mid to high suggest they have a moderate level of price sensitivity, as they do not shy away from spending on appealing content but remain critical of underwhelming productions.

Common themes within their viewing choices include a blend of historical and contemporary relevance, coupled with a penchant for humor and irony—a juxtaposition of serious topics with comedic undertones. Quality seems paramount, as seen in their positive responses to shows perceived as thoughtfully produced versus those they deemed lacking, which received lower ratings. While they show a willingness to engage with diverse narratives, they display a marked hesitation towards simplistic or poorly executed content, indicating a desire for substance and originality.

Ultimately, their core preferences revolve around engaging, intellectually stimulating programming with a balance of humor and critical reflection on societal norms. Price sensitivity is visible but not prohibitive, suggesting they seek quality experiences that justify their expenditure.

target_interaction.title: Jaw dropping, complex, entertaining
target_interaction.text: I've been waiting for entertainment that approaches real issues with depth. I have only watched a few episodes, but I am blown away.
description: American Gothic centers on a prominent Boston family reeling in the wake of the chilling discovery that someone in their midst is linked to an infamous string of murders.
target_interaction.subtitle: Season 1
